title: Does the SDS include naming conventions to be used?
description: Does the SDS include naming conventions to be used?

title: Does the SDS include the design description methods to be used?
description: Does the SDS include the design description methods to be used?

title: Do the notations used to define formal models have mathematically defined syntax and semantics, and are constraints compatible with formal methods?
description: Do the notations used to define formal models have mathematically defined syntax and semantics, and are constraints compatible with formal methods?

title: Does the SDS include conditions imposed on permitted design methods (e.g., scheduling, use of interrupts and event-driven architectures, dynamic tasking, re-entry, global data, exception handling and the rationale for their use)?
description: Does the SDS include conditions imposed on permitted design methods (e.g., scheduling, use of interrupts and event-driven architectures, dynamic tasking, re-entry, global data, exception handling and the rationale for their use)?

title: Does the SDS include constraints on the use of design tools?
description: Does the SDS include constraints on the use of design tools?

title: Does the SDS include constraints on design (e.g., exclusion of recursion, dynamic objects, data aliases, and compacted expressions)?
description: Does the SDS include constraints on design (e.g., exclusion of recursion, dynamic objects, data aliases, and compacted expressions)?

title: Does the SDS include complexity restrictions (e.g., maximum nesting levels or conditional structures, use of unconditional branches, number of entry/exit points of code components)?
description: Does the SDS include complexity restrictions (e.g., maximum nesting levels or conditional structures, use of unconditional branches, number of entry/exit points of code components)?

title: Does the SDS include constraints of the OOT & RT features addressing vulnerabilities such as inheritance, parametric polymorphism, overloading, type conversion, exception management, dynamic memory management and virtualization (see Annex OO.D.1)?
description: Does the SDS include constraints of the OOT & RT features addressing vulnerabilities such as inheritance, parametric polymorphism, overloading, type conversion, exception management, dynamic memory management and virtualization (see Annex OO.D.1)?

title: If low-level requirements or software architecture are expressed as a model, do the design standards include the model standards (see separate Software Modeling Standards?  (See SMS checklist for more details)
description: If low-level requirements or software architecture are expressed as a model, do the design standards include the model standards (see separate Software Modeling Standards?  (See SMS checklist for more details)

title: Will adherence to the SDS enable software components of a given software product or related set of products to be uniformly designed and implemented?
description: Will adherence to the SDS enable software components of a given software product or related set of products to be uniformly designed and implemented?

title: Does the SDS prevent the use of constructs or methods that produce outputs that cannot be verified or that are not compatible with safety-related requirements?
description: Does the SDS prevent the use of constructs or methods that produce outputs that cannot be verified or that are not compatible with safety-related requirements?

title: Does the SDS include considerations regarding the robustness of requirements?
description: Does the SDS include considerations regarding the robustness of requirements?

title: Is the SDS under configuration management category CC1?
description: Is the SDS under configuration management category CC1?

title: Is the SDS under configuration management category CC2?
description: Is the SDS under configuration management category CC2?
